It stores global, collection-based occurrence and taxonomic data for marine and terrestrial animals and plants of any geological age, as well as web-based software for statistical analysis of the data.

datatype.name: Compulyeast
datatype.definition: Compluyeast-2D-DB is a two-dimensional polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis federated database. This collection references a subset of Uniprot, and contains general information about the protein record.

resource.dataInfo: Compluyeast database at Universidad Complutense Madrid
resource.dataInstitution: Department Microbiology II, Universidad Complutense Madrid, Madrid

datatype.name: DisProt
datatype.definition: The Database of Protein Disorder (DisProt) is a curated database that provides information about proteins that lack fixed 3D structure in their putatively native states, either in their entirety or in part.

resource.dataInstitution: Center for Computational Biology and Bioinformatics, Indiana University School of Medicine, Indianapolis

datatype.name: EchoBASE
datatype.definition: EchoBASE is a database designed to contain and manipulate information from post-genomic experiments using the model bacterium Escherichia coli K-12. The database is built on an enhanced annotation of the updated genome sequence of strain MG1655 and the association of experimental data with the E.coli genes and their products.

resource.dataInfo: EchoBASE at the University of York
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Biology (Area 10), University of York, York

datatype.name: eggNOG
datatype.definition: eggNOG (evolutionary genealogy of genes: Non-supervised Orthologous Groups) is a database of orthologous groups of genes. The orthologous groups are annotated with functional description lines (derived by identifying a common denominator for the genes based on their various annotations), with functional categories (i.e derived from the original COG/KOG categories).

resource.dataInfo: eggNOG Version 3 at European Molecular Biology Laboratory
eggNOG Version 2 at European Molecular Biology Laboratory

datatype.name: Ensembl Bacteria
datatype.definition: Ensembl Genomes consists of five sub-portals (for bacteria, protists, fungi, plants and invertebrate metazoa) designed to complement the availability of vertebrate genomes in Ensembl. This collection is concerned with bacterial genomes.

datatype.name: Ensembl Protists
datatype.definition: Ensembl Genomes consists of five sub-portals (for bacteria, protists, fungi, plants and invertebrate metazoa) designed to complement the availability of vertebrate genomes in Ensembl. This collection is concerned with protist genomes.

datatype.name: Ensembl Metazoa
datatype.definition: Ensembl Genomes consists of five sub-portals (for bacteria, protists, fungi, plants and invertebrate metazoa) designed to complement the availability of vertebrate genomes in Ensembl. This collection is concerned with metazoa genomes.

datatype.name: Ensembl Plants
datatype.definition: Ensembl Genomes consists of five sub-portals (for bacteria, protists, fungi, plants and invertebrate metazoa) designed to complement the availability of vertebrate genomes in Ensembl. This collection is concerned with plant genomes.

datatype.name: Ensembl Fungi
datatype.definition: Ensembl Genomes consists of five sub-portals (for bacteria, protists, fungi, plants and invertebrate metazoa) designed to complement the availability of vertebrate genomes in Ensembl. This collection is concerned with fungal genomes.

datatype.name: HCVDB
datatype.definition: the European Hepatitis C Virus Database (euHCVdb, http://euhcvdb.ibcp.fr), a collection of computer-annotated sequences based on reference genomes.mainly dedicated to HCV protein sequences, 3D structures and functional analyses.

resource.dataInstitution: Institut de Biologie et Chimie des Protines, CNRS, University of Lyon , Lyon-Gerland

datatype.name: Genatlas
datatype.definition: GenAtlas is a database containing information on human genes, markers and phenotypes.

datatype.name: CATH superfamily
datatype.definition: The CATH database is a hierarchical domain classification of protein structures in the Protein Data Bank. Protein structures are classified using a combination of automated and manual procedures. There are four major levels in this hierarchy; Class (secondary structure classification, e.g. mostly alpha), Architecture (classification based on overall shape), Topology (fold family) and Homologous superfamily (protein domains which are thought to share a common ancestor). This colelction is concerned with superfamily classification.

resource.dataInstitution: Institute of Structural and Molecular Biology, University College London

datatype.name: CATH domain
datatype.definition: The CATH database is a hierarchical domain classification of protein structures in the Protein Data Bank. Protein structures are classified using a combination of automated and manual procedures. There are four major levels in this hierarchy; Class (secondary structure classification, e.g. mostly alpha), Architecture (classification based on overall shape), Topology (fold family) and Homologous superfamily (protein domains which are thought to share a common ancestor). This colelction is concerned with CATH domains.

resource.dataInstitution: Institute of Structural and Molecular Biology, University College London

datatype.name: GeneFarm
datatype.definition: GeneFarm is a database whose purpose is to store traceable annotations for Arabidopsis nuclear genes and gene products.

resource.dataInfo: GeneFarm at Unit de Recherche en Gnomique Vgtale
resource.dataInstitution: Unit de Recherche en Gnomique Vgtale, Evry

datatype.name: GPCRDB
datatype.definition: The G protein-coupled receptor database (GPCRDB) collects, large amounts of heterogeneous data on GPCRs. It contains experimental data on sequences, ligand-binding constants, mutations and oligomers, and derived data such as multiple sequence alignments and homology models.

resource.dataInstitution: Radboud University Nijmegen Medical Centre, Nijmegen,

datatype.name: HOGENOM
datatype.definition: HOGENOM is a database of homologous genes from fully sequenced organisms (bacteria, archeae and eukarya). This collection references phylogenetic trees which can be retrieved using either UniProt accession numbers, or HOGENOM tree family identifier.

resource.dataInstitution: Laboratoire de Biomtrie et Biologie Evolutive, CNRS, Lyon

datatype.name: GeneTree
datatype.definition: Genetree displays the maximum likelihood phylogenetic (protein) trees representing the evolutionary history of the genes. These are constructed using the canonical protein for every gene in Ensembl.

resource.dataInstitution: Sanger Institute and European Bioinformatics Institute, Hinxton, Cambridge

datatype.name: HSSP
datatype.definition: HSSP (homology-derived structures of proteins) is a derived database merging structural (2-D and 3-D) and sequence information (1-D). For each protein of known 3D structure from the Protein Data Bank, the database has a file with all sequence homologues, properly aligned to the PDB protein.

resource.dataInstitution: Protein Design Group, European Molecular Biology Laboratory, Heidelberg
Nijmegen Centre for Molecular Life Sciences, CMBI, Nijmegen

datatype.name: MycoBrowser tuberculosis
datatype.definition: Mycobrowser is a resource that provides both in silico generated and manually reviewed information within databases dedicated to the complete genomes of Mycobacterium tuberculosis, Mycobacterium leprae, Mycobacterium marinum and Mycobacterium smegmatis. This collection references Mycobacteria tuberculosis information.

resource.dataInfo: MycoBrowser tuberculosis at Global Health Institute

datatype.name: MycoBrowser leprae
datatype.definition: Mycobrowser is a resource that provides both in silico generated and manually reviewed information within databases dedicated to the complete genomes of Mycobacterium tuberculosis, Mycobacterium leprae, Mycobacterium marinum and Mycobacterium smegmatis. This collection references Mycobacteria leprae information.

resource.dataInfo: MycoBrowser leprae at Global Health Institute

datatype.name: MycoBrowser marinum
datatype.definition: Mycobrowser is a resource that provides both in silico generated and manually reviewed information within databases dedicated to the complete genomes of Mycobacterium tuberculosis, Mycobacterium leprae, Mycobacterium marinum and Mycobacterium smegmatis. This collection references Mycobacteria marinum information.

resource.dataInfo: MycoBrowser marinum at Global Health Institute

datatype.name: MycoBrowser smegmatis
datatype.definition: Mycobrowser is a resource that provides both in silico generated and manually reviewed information within databases dedicated to the complete genomes of Mycobacterium tuberculosis, Mycobacterium leprae, Mycobacterium marinum and Mycobacterium smegmatis. This collection references Mycobacteria smegmatis information.

resource.dataInfo: MycoBrowser smegmatis at Global Health Institute

datatype.name: Orphanet
datatype.definition: Orphanet is a reference portal for information on rare diseases and orphan drugs. Its aim is to help improve the diagnosis, care and treatment of patients with rare diseases.

datatype.name: OrthoDB
datatype.definition: OrthoDB presents a catalog of eukaryotic orthologous protein-coding genes across vertebrates, arthropods, and fungi. Orthology refers to the last common ancestor of the species under consideration, and thus OrthoDB explicitly delineates orthologs at each radiation along the species phylogeny. The database of orthologs presents available protein descriptors, together with Gene Ontology and InterPro attributes, which serve to provide general descriptive annotations of the orthologous groups

resource.dataInfo: OrthoDB at Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Genetic Medicine and Development, Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics, Geneva

datatype.name: Peroxibase
datatype.definition: Peroxibase provides access to peroxidase sequences from all kingdoms of life, and provides a series of bioinformatics tools and facilities suitable for analysing these sequences.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Plant Biology, University of Geneva, Geneva

datatype.name: PhylomeDB
datatype.definition: PhylomeDB is a database of complete phylomes derived for different genomes within a specific taxonomic range. It provides alignments, phylogentic trees and tree-based orthology predictions for all encoded proteins.

resource.dataInfo: PhylomeDB at Centro de Investigacin Prncipe Felipe
resource.dataInstitution: Bioinformatics Department,Centro de Investigacin Prncipe Felipe, Valencia

datatype.name: SubstrateDB
datatype.definition: The Proteolysis MAP is a resource for proteolytic networks and pathways. PMAP is comprised of five databases, linked together in one environment. SubstrateDB contains molecular information on documented protease substrates.

resource.dataInfo: SubstrateDB at The Burnham Institute for Medical Research
resource.dataInstitution: The Center on Proteolytic Pathways, The Cancer Research Center and The Inflammatory and Infectious Disease Center, The Burnham Institute for Medical Research, California

datatype.name: CutDB
datatype.definition: The Proteolysis MAP is a resource for proteolytic networks and pathways. PMAP is comprised of five databases, linked together in one environment. CutDB is a database of individual proteolytic events (cleavage sites).

resource.dataInfo: CutDB at The Burnham Institute for Medical Research
resource.dataInstitution: The Center on Proteolytic Pathways, The Cancer Research Center and The Inflammatory and Infectious Disease Center, The Burnham Institute for Medical Research, California

datatype.name: ProtClustDB
datatype.definition: ProtClustDB is a collection of related protein sequences (clusters) consisting of Reference Sequence proteins encoded by complete genomes. This database contains both curated and non-curated clusters.

datatype.name: PMP
datatype.definition: The number of known protein sequences exceeds those of experimentally solved protein structures. Homology (or comparative) modeling methods make use of experimental protein structures to build models for evolutionary related proteins. The Protein Model Portal (PMP) provides a single portal to access these models, which are accessed through their UniProt identifiers.

datatype.name: ProtoNet ProteinCard
datatype.definition: ProtoNet provides automatic hierarchical classification of protein sequences in the UniProt database, partitioning the protein space into clusters of similar proteins. This collection references protein information.

datatype.name: ProtoNet Cluster
datatype.definition: ProtoNet provides automatic hierarchical classification of protein sequences in the UniProt database, partitioning the protein space into clusters of similar proteins. This collection references cluster information.

datatype.name: REBASE
datatype.definition: REBASE is a comprehensive database of information about restriction enzymes, DNA methyltransferases and related proteins involved in the biological process of restriction-modification (R-M). It contains fully referenced information about recognition and cleavage sites, isoschizomers, neoschizomers, commercial availability, methylation sensitivity, crystal and sequence data.

datatype.name: SWISS-MODEL Repository
datatype.definition: The SWISS-MODEL Repository is a database of 3D protein structure models generated by the SWISS-MODEL homology-modelling pipeline for UniProtKB protein sequences.

resource.dataInfo: SWISS-MODEL at SIB Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics
resource.dataInstitution: Biozentrum, University of Basel and SIB Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics, Basel

restriction.statement: Identifiers to individual models are not stable, since they can change between releases.

datatype.name: VectorBase
datatype.definition: VectorBase is an NIAID-funded Bioinformatic Resource Center focused on invertebrate vectors of human pathogens. VectorBase annotates and curates vector genomes providing a web accessible integrated resource for the research community. Currently, VectorBase contains genome information for three mosquito species: Aedes aegypti, Anopheles gambiae and Culex quinquefasciatus, a body louse Pediculus humanus and a tick species Ixodes scapularis.

datatype.name: Human Disease Ontology
datatype.definition: The Disease Ontology has been developed as a standardized ontology for human disease with the purpose of providing the biomedical community with consistent, reusable and sustainable descriptions of human disease terms, phenotype characteristics and related medical vocabulary disease concepts.

resource.dataInstitution: National Center for Biomedical Ontology, Stanford University

resource.dataInfo: Human Disease Ontology at Northwestern University
resource.dataInstitution: University of Maryland (Maryland) and Northwestern University (Illinois)

datatype.name: Cell Cycle Ontology
datatype.definition: The Cell Cycle Ontology is an application ontology that captures and integrates detailed knowledge on the cell cycle process.

resource.dataInstitution: National Center for Biomedical Ontology, Stanford

datatype.name: miRBase mature sequence
datatype.definition: The miRBase Sequence Database is a searchable database of published miRNA sequences and annotation. This collection refers specifically to the mature miRNA sequence.

resource.dataInstitution: Faculty of Life Sciences, University of Manchester

datatype.name: nextProt
datatype.definition: neXtProt is a resource on human proteins, and includes information such as proteins function, subcellular location, expression, interactions and role in diseases.

resource.dataInfo: nextProt at Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics

datatype.name: CAS
datatype.definition: CAS (Chemical Abstracts Service) is a division of the American Chemical Society and is the producer of comprehensive databases of chemical information.

restriction.statement: CAS provides fee-based services.

datatype.name: KEGG Genome
datatype.definition: KEGG Genome is a collection of organisms whose genomes have been completely sequenced.

datatype.name: KEGG Metagenome
datatype.definition: The KEGG Metagenome Database collection information on environmental samples (ecosystems) of genome sequences for multiple species.

datatype.name: NARCIS

synonyms.synonym: National Academic Research and Collaborations Information System

datatype.definition: NARCIS provides access to scientific information, including (open access) publications from the repositories of all the Dutch universities, KNAW, NWO and a number of research institutes, which is not referenced in other citation databases.

resource.dataInstitution: NARCIS, Royal Netherlands Academy of Science and Arts

datatype.name: Japan Chemical Substance Dictionary
datatype.definition: The Japan Chemical Substance Dictionary is an organic compound dictionary database prepared by the Japan Science and Technology Agency (JST).

datatype.name: Pathway Ontology
datatype.definition: The Pathway Ontology captures information on biological networks, the relationships between netweorks and the alterations or malfunctioning of such networks within a hierarchical structure. The five main branches of the ontology are: classic metabolic pathways, regulatory, signaling, drug, and disease pathwaysfor complex human conditions.

resource.dataInfo: Pathway Ontology at Rat Genome Database

resource.dataInstitution: National Center for Biomedical Ontology, Stanford, California

datatype.name: Sequence Read Archive
datatype.definition: The Sequence Read Archive (SRA) stores raw sequencing data from the next generation of sequencing platforms Data submitted to SRA. It is organized using a metadata model consisting of six objects: study, sample, experiment, run, analysis and submission. The SRA study contains high-level information including goals of the study and literature references, and may be linked to the INSDC BioProject database.

resource.dataInstitution: DNA Data Bank of Japan, Mishima, Shizuoka

datatype.name: ScerTF
datatype.definition: ScerTF is a database of position weight matrices (PWMs) for transcription factors in Saccharomyces species. It identifies a single matrix for each TF that best predicts in vivo data, providing metrics related to the performance of that matrix in accurately representing the DNA binding specificity of the annotated transcription factor.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Genetics, Washington University Medical School, St Louis, Missouri

datatype.name: PharmGKB Gene
datatype.definition: The PharmGKB database is a central repository for genetic, genomic, molecular and cellular phenotype data and clinical information about people who have participated in pharmacogenomics research studies. The data includes, but is not limited to, clinical and basic pharmacokinetic and pharmacogenomic research in the cardiovascular, pulmonary, cancer, pathways, metabolic and transporter domains.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Genetics, School of Medicine, Stanford University, Stanford, California

datatype.name: miRNEST
datatype.definition: miRNEST is a database of animal, plant and virus microRNAs, containing miRNA predictions conducted on Expressed Sequence Tags of animal and plant species.

resource.dataInstitution: Institute of Molecular Biology, Adam Mickiewicz University, Poznan

datatype.name: NAPP
datatype.definition: NAPP (Nucleic Acids Phylogenetic Profiling is a clustering method based on conserved noncoding RNA (ncRNA) elements in a bacterial genomes. Short intergenic regions from a reference genome are compared with other genomes to identify RNA rich clusters.

resource.dataInstitution: Institut de Gntique et Microbiologie, UMR 8621, CNRS, Universit Paris Sud, Paris

datatype.name: NONCODE v3
datatype.definition: NONCODE is a database of expression and functional lncRNA (long noncoding RNA) data obtained from microarray studies. LncRNAs have been shown to play key roles in various biological processes such as imprinting control, circuitry controlling pluripotency and differentiation, immune responses and chromosome dynamics. The collection references NONCODE version 3. This was replaced in 2013 by version 4.

resource.dataInfo: NONCODE at Chinese Academy of Sciences
resource.dataInstitution: Bioinformatics Research Group, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing

datatype.name: VIRsiRNA
datatype.definition: The VIRsiRNA database contains details of siRNA/shRNA which target viral genome regions. It provides efficacy information where available, as well as the siRNA sequence, viral target and subtype, as well as the target genomic region.

resource.dataInfo: VIRsiRNA at Institute of Microbial Technology
resource.dataInstitution: Institute of Microbial Technology, Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), Chandigarh, India

datatype.name: ELM
datatype.definition: Linear motifs are short, evolutionarily plastic components of regulatory proteins. Mainly focused on the eukaryotic sequences,the Eukaryotic Linear Motif resource (ELM) is a database of curated motif classes and instances.

resource.dataInstitution: Structural and Computational Biology, European Molecular Biology Laboratory, Heidelberg

datatype.name: MimoDB
datatype.definition: MimoDB is a database collecting peptides that have been selected from random peptide libraries based on their ability to bind small compounds, nucleic acids, proteins, cells, tissues and organs. It also stores other information such as the corresponding target, template, library, and structures. As of March 2016, this database was renamed Biopanning Data Bank.

resource.dataInfo: BDB at University of Electronic Science and Technology of China
resource.dataInstitution: Key Laboratory for Neuroinformation of Ministry of Education, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Sichuan

datatype.name: SitEx
datatype.definition: SitEx is a database containing information on eukaryotic protein functional sites. It stores the amino acid sequence positions in the functional site, in relation to the exon structure of encoding gene This can be used to detect the exons involved in shuffling in protein evolution, or to design protein-engineering experiments.

datatype.name: BYKdb
datatype.definition: The bacterial tyrosine kinase database (BYKdb) that collects sequences of putative and authentic bacterial tyrosine kinases, providing structural and functional information.

resource.dataInstitution: Unit Bases Molculaires et Structurales des Systmes Infectieux; CNRS - Universit Claude Bernard, Lyon

datatype.name: Conoserver
datatype.definition: ConoServer is a database specialized in the sequence and structures of conopeptides, which are peptides expressed by carnivorous marine cone snails.

resource.dataInstitution: Institute for Molecular Bioscience, The University of Queensland, Brisbane

restriction.statement: Conoserver can only be used for academic research.

datatype.name: TopFind
datatype.definition: TopFIND is a database of protein termini, terminus modifications and their proteolytic processing in the species: Homo sapiens, Mus musculus, Arabidopsis thaliana, Saccharomyces cerevisiae and Escherichia coli.

resource.dataInfo: TopFind at University of British Columbia
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Oral Biological and Medical Sciences, University of British Columbia, Vancouver

datatype.name: MIPModDB
datatype.definition: MIPModDb is a database of comparative protein structure models of MIP (Major Intrinsic Protein) family of proteins, identified from complete genome sequence. It provides key information of MIPs based on their sequence and structures.

resource.dataInfo: MIPModDB at Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Biological Sciences and Bioengineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, Kanpur

datatype.name: Cell Image Library

synonyms.synonym: The Cell: An Image Library-Cell Centered Database

datatype.definition: The Cell: An Image Library is a freely accessible, public repository of reviewed and annotated images, videos, and animations of cells from a variety of organisms, showcasing cell architecture, intracellular functionalities, and both normal and abnormal processes.

resource.dataInfo: Cell Image Library at American Society for Cell Biology
resource.dataInstitution: American Society for Cell Biology, Bethesda, Maryland and The National Center for Microscopy and Imaging Research, San Diego, California

restriction.statement: Each image may be individually associated with its own copyright restriction, which should be consulted for appropriateness by users.

datatype.name: COMBINE specifications
datatype.definition: The 'COmputational Modeling in BIology' NEtwork (COMBINE) is an initiative to coordinate the development of the various community standards and formats for computational models, initially in Systems Biology and related fields. This collection pertains to specifications of the standard formats developed by the Computational Modeling in Biology Network.

datatype.name: ZFIN Phenotype
datatype.definition: ZFIN serves as the zebrafish model organism database. This collection references the phenotypes observed for any given genotype.

resource.dataInfo: ZFIN Phenotype at University of Oregon
resource.dataInstitution: Zebrafish Information Network, University of Oregon, USA

datatype.name: ZFIN Expression
datatype.definition: ZFIN serves as the zebrafish model organism database. This collection references the set of expressed genes for any given genotype.

resource.dataInfo: ZFIN Expression at University of Oregon
resource.dataInstitution: Zebrafish Information Network, University of Oregon, USA

datatype.name: CABRI
datatype.definition: CABRI (Common Access to Biotechnological Resources and Information) is an online service where users can search a number of European Biological Resource Centre catalogues. It lists the availability of a particular organism or genetic resource and defines the set of technical specifications and procedures which should be used to handle it.

resource.dataInfo: CABRI Cell Lines catalogue in Genova (SRS)
resource.dataInstitution: National Cancer Research Institute of Genova, Genova

resource.dataInfo: CABRI Cell Lines catalogue in Brussels (SRS)
CABRI Cell Lines catalogue in Paris (SRS)

datatype.name: CYGD
datatype.definition: The MIPS Comprehensive Yeast Genome Database (CYGD) provides information on the molecular structure and functional network of the entirely sequenced the budding yeast, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, as well as on related yeasts which are used for comparative analysis.

resource.dataInfo: CYGD PEDANT Interface at Biomax Informatics

resource.dataInstitution: Helmholtz Zentrum Mnchen - Deutsches Forschungszentrum fr Gesundheit und Umwelt, GmbH, Neuherberg

restriction.statement: Accompanying disclaimer on each page states that data and services are for academic, non-commercial use only.

datatype.name: HUGE
datatype.definition: The Human Unidentified Gene-Encoded (HUGE) protein database contains results from sequence analysis of human novel large (>4 kb) cDNAs identified in the Kazusa cDNA sequencing project.

resource.dataInfo: HUGE at Kazusa DNA Research Institute

restriction.statement: The information provided is for research purposes only.

link.desc: Terms and conditions of data use.

datatype.name: BindingDB
datatype.definition: BindingDB is a public, web-accessible database of measured binding affinities, focusing chiefly on the interactions of protein considered to be drug-targets with small, drug-like molecules.

resource.dataInfo: BindingDB At Skaggs School of Pharmacy & Pharmaceutical Sciences
resource.dataInstitution: Skaggs School of Pharmacy & Pharmaceutical Sciences, La Jolla, California

datatype.name: STRING

synonyms.synonym: Search Tool for Retrieval of Interacting Genes/Proteins

datatype.definition: STRING (Search Tool for Retrieval of Interacting Genes/Proteins) is a database of known and predicted protein interactions. The interactions include direct (physical) and indirect (functional) associations; they are derived from four sources:Genomic Context, High-throughput Experiments,(Conserved) Coexpression, Previous Knowledge. STRING quantitatively integrates interaction data from these sources for a large number of organisms, and transfers information between these organisms where applicable.

restriction.statement: Identifiers are regenerated each time a new STRING version is released, hence the specific information recorded between versions may differ.

datatype.name: STITCH
datatype.definition: STITCH is a resource to explore known and predicted interactions of chemicals and proteins. Chemicals are linked to other chemicals and proteins by evidence derived from experiments, databases and the literature.

restriction.statement: Identifiers are regenerated each time a new version is released. The best way to reference this information is to use the first segment (14 characters) of an InChi key.

datatype.name: Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Vetinary
datatype.definition: The ATCvet system for the classification of veterinary medicines is based on the same overall principles as the ATC system for substances used in human medicine. In ATCvet systems, preparations are divided into groups, according to their therapeutic use. First, they are divided into 15 anatomical groups (1st level), classified as QA-QV in the ATCvet system, on the basis of their main therapeutic use.

resource.dataInfo: Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Vet Index at WHO

datatype.name: Phenol-Explorer
datatype.definition: Phenol-Explorer is an electronic database on polyphenol content in foods. Polyphenols form a wide group of natural antioxidants present in a large number of foods and beverages. They contribute to food characteristics such as taste, colour or shelf-life. They also participate in the prevention of several major chronic diseases such as cardiovascular diseases, diabetes, cancers, neurodegenerative diseases or osteoporosis.

resource.dataInfo: Phenol-Explorer Database on Phenol content of foods

datatype.name: SNOMED CT
datatype.definition: SNOMED CT (Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine -- Clinical Terms), is a systematically organized computer processable collection of medical terminology covering most areas of clinical information such as diseases, findings, procedures, microorganisms, pharmaceuticals, etc.

resource.dataInfo: SNOMED-CT at The National Pathology Exchange
resource.dataInstitution: The Health Informatics Service, NHS, West Yorkshire
Virginia Maryland Regional College of Veterinary Medicine, Virginia

resource.dataInfo: SNOMED CT at The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organization.

restriction.statement: Access to data may require a license, depending on whether or not it is used in a member country, and for a particular purpose.

datatype.name: MeSH 2012
datatype.definition: MeSH (Medical Subject Headings) is the National Library of Medicine's controlled vocabulary thesaurus. It consists of sets of terms naming descriptors in a hierarchical structure that permits searching at various levels of specificity. This thesaurus is used by NLM for indexing articles from biomedical journals, cataloging of books, documents, etc. This collection references MeSH terms published in 2012.

resource.dataInfo: MeSH at National Library of Medicine
resource.dataInstitution: U.S. National Library of Medicine, National Institute of Health, Maryland
National Center for Biomedical Ontology, Stanford University

restriction.statement: Records accessed through MESH may include content that itself has some copyright restriction when reproduced.

Access to Mesh 2012 uses identifiers that could potentially change. We recommend the use of the stable MeSH collection (http://identifiers.org/mesh/). If you have issues accessing Mesh 2012, you may wish to try the ftp service.

datatype.name: KnapSack
datatype.definition: Knapsack provides information on metabolites and the taxonomic class with which they are associated.

resource.dataInstitution: Nara Institute of Science and Technology

datatype.name: Canadian Drug Product Database
datatype.definition: The Canadian Drug Product Database (DPD) contains product specific information on drugs approved for use in Canada, and includes human pharmaceutical and biological drugs, veterinary drugs and disinfectant products. This information includes 'brand name', 'route of administration' and a Canadian 'Drug Identification Number' (DIN).

resource.dataInfo: Canadian Drug Identification Number at Health Canada

restriction.statement: Need an active session to access information (timeout set at 29 mins).

datatype.name: MassBank
datatype.definition: MassBank is a federated database of reference spectra from different instruments, including high-resolution mass spectra of small metabolites (<3000 Da).

resource.dataInstitution: NORMAN Network and The MassBank Consortium

restriction.statement: Downloading, copying, saving, or printing out of materials for purposes other than academic research or education is prohibited.

datatype.name: Golm Metabolome Database
datatype.definition: Golm Metabolome Database (GMD) provides public access to custom mass spectral libraries, metabolite profiling experiments as well as additional information and tools. This collection references metabolite information, relating the biologically active substance to metabolic pathways or signalling phenomena.

resource.dataInfo: Golm Metabolome Database at Max Planck Institute of Molecular Plant Physiology
resource.dataInstitution: Max Planck Institute of Molecular Plant Physiology, Potsdam

restriction.statement: Data in this collection is restricted for non-academic users.

datatype.name: HomoloGene
datatype.definition: HomoloGene is a system for automated detection of homologs among the annotated genes of several completely sequenced eukaryotic genomes.

datatype.name: UM-BBD Compound
datatype.definition: The University of Minnesota Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database (UM-BBD) contains information on microbial biocatalytic reactions and biodegradation pathways for primarily xenobiotic, chemical compounds. The goal of the UM-BBD is to provide information on microbial enzyme-catalyzed reactions that are important for biotechnology. This collection refers to compound information.

resource.dataInfo: Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database Mirror (Compound) at ETH Zurich
Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database (Compound) at University of Minnesota
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Laboratory Medicine and Pathology, University of Minnesota, Minnesota

datatype.name: ABS
datatype.definition: The database of Annotated regulatory Binding Sites (from orthologous promoters), ABS, is a public database of known binding sites identified in promoters of orthologous vertebrate genes that have been manually curated from bibliography.

datatype.name: APD
datatype.definition: The antimicrobial peptide database (APD) provides information on anticancer, antiviral, antifungal and antibacterial peptides.

resource.dataInstitution: Eppley Institute for Research in Cancer and Allied Diseases, University of Nebraska Medical Center, Omaha

datatype.name: ChemDB
datatype.definition: ChemDB is a chemical database containing commercially available small molecules, important for use as synthetic building blocks, probes in systems biology and as leads for the discovery of drugs and other useful compounds.

restriction.statement: Commercial access may require acquisition of a license.

datatype.name: DPV
datatype.definition: Description of Plant Viruses (DPV) provides information about viruses, viroids and satellites of plants, fungi and protozoa. It provides taxonomic information, including brief descriptions of each family and genus, and classified lists of virus sequences. The database also holds detailed information for all sequences of viruses, viroids and satellites of plants, fungi and protozoa that are complete or that contain at least one complete gene.

resource.dataInstitution: Plant-Pathogen Interactions Division, Wheat Pathogenesis Programme, Rothamsted Research Harpenden, Hertfordshire

restriction.statement: Information on this site may be subject to copyright.

datatype.name: IUPHAR receptor

synonyms.synonym: International Union of Basic and Clinical Pharmacology

datatype.definition: The IUPHAR Compendium details the molecular, biophysical and pharmacological properties of identified mammalian sodium, calcium and potassium channels, as well as the related cyclic nucleotide-modulated ion channels and transient receptor potential channels. It includes information on nomenclature systems, and on inter and intra-species molecular structure variation. This collection references individual receptors or subunits.

resource.dataInfo: IUPHAR Receptor at University of Edinburgh
resource.dataInstitution: Centre for Cardiovascular Science, University of Edinburgh, Edinburgh

restriction.statement: Material from this site may be downloaded for personal, non-commercial use.

datatype.name: Aceview Worm
datatype.definition: AceView provides a curated sequence representation of all public mRNA sequences (mRNAs from GenBank or RefSeq, and single pass cDNA sequences from dbEST and Trace). These are aligned on the genome and clustered into a minimal number of alternative transcript variants and grouped into genes. In addition, alternative features such as promoters, and expression in tissues is recorded. This collection references C. elegans genes and expression.

datatype.name: ASAP
datatype.definition: ASAP (a systematic annotation package for community analysis of genomes) stores bacterial genome sequence and functional characterization data. It includes multiple genome sequences at various stages of analysis, corresponding experimental data and access to collections of related genome resources.

resource.dataInstitution: Animal Health and Biomedical Sciences, University of Wisconsin, Madison

restriction.statement: May require the acceptance of terms and conditions.

link.desc: Terms and conditions of data use.

datatype.name: ATCC
datatype.definition: The American Type Culture Collection (ATCC) is a private, nonprofit biological resource center whose mission focuses on the acquisition, authentication, production, preservation, development and distribution of standard reference microorganisms, cell lines and other materials for research in the life sciences.

resource.dataInstitution: American Type Culture Collection, Manassas, Virginia

datatype.name: BDGP EST
datatype.definition: The BDGP EST database collects the expressed sequence tags (ESTs) derived from a variety of tissues and developmental stages for Drosophila melanogaster. All BDGP ESTs are available at dbEST (NCBI).

restriction.statement: Data is a subset of a larger collection.

datatype.name: Dictybase Gene
datatype.definition: The dictyBase database provides data on the model organism Dictyostelium discoideum and related species. It contains the complete genome sequence, ESTs, gene models and functional annotations. This collection references gene information.

resource.dataInstitution: Northwestern University Biomedical Informatics Center and Center for Genetic Medicine, Chicago, Illinois

datatype.name: IMGT LIGM
datatype.definition: IMGT, the international ImMunoGeneTics project, is a collection of high-quality integrated databases specialising in Immunoglobulins, T cell receptors and the Major Histocompatibility Complex (MHC) of all vertebrate species. IMGT/LIGM is a comprehensive database of fully annotated sequences of Immunoglobulins and T cell receptors from human and other vertebrates.

restriction.statement: The data are provided as a service to the scientific community to be used only for research and educational purposes.

datatype.name: Worfdb
datatype.definition: WOrfDB (Worm ORFeome DataBase) contains data from the cloning of complete set of predicted protein-encoding Open Reading Frames (ORFs) of Caenorhabditis elegans. This collection describes experimentally defined transcript structures of unverified genes through RACE (Rapid Amplification of cDNA Ends).

resource.dataInstitution: Center for Cancer Systems Biology, Harvard Medical School, Massachusetts

datatype.name: NEXTDB
datatype.definition: NextDb is a database that provides information on the expression pattern map of the 100Mb genome of the nematode Caenorhabditis elegans. This was done through EST analysis and systematic whole mount in situ hybridization. Information available includes 5' and 3' ESTs, and in-situ hybridization images of 11,237 cDNA clones.

restriction.statement: The information does not appear to have been updated in a number of years.

datatype.comment: As of November 2013, this collection is no longer accessible.
datatype.name: Plant Genome Network
datatype.definition: The Plant Genome Network (PGN) is a resource for the storage, retrieval and annotation of plant ESTs, with a focus on comparative genomics. All data are directly derived from chromatograms with original and intermediate data stored in the database.

datatype.name: SoyBase
datatype.definition: SoyBase is a repository for curated genetics, genomics and related data resources for soybean.

datatype.name: HAMAP

synonyms.synonym: High-quality Automated and Manual Annotation of microbial Proteomes

datatype.definition: HAMAP is a system that identifies and semi-automatically annotates proteins that are part of well-conserved and orthologous microbial families or subfamilies. These are used to build rules which are used to propagate annotations to member bacterial, archaeal and plastid-encoded protein entries.

resource.dataInfo: HAPMAP at Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics

datatype.name: Rouge
datatype.definition: The Rouge protein database contains results from sequence analysis of novel large (>4 kb) cDNAs identified in the Kazusa cDNA sequencing project.

resource.dataInfo: Rouge at Kazusa DNA Research Institute

restriction.statement: The information provided is for research purposes only.

link.desc: Terms and conditions of data use.

datatype.name: ArrayExpress Platform
datatype.definition: ArrayExpress is a public repository for microarray data, which is aimed at storing MIAME-compliant data in accordance with Microarray Gene Expression Data (MGED) recommendations.This collection references the specific platforms used in the generation of experimental results.

datatype.name: CGSC Strain
datatype.definition: The CGSC Database of E. coli genetic information includes genotypes and reference information for the strains in the CGSC collection, the names, synonyms, properties, and map position for genes, gene product information, and information on specific mutations and references to primary literature.

resource.dataInstitution: Dept. of Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology, Yale University, Conneticut

datatype.comment: As of September 2013, this collection is no longer maintained. Various archives are available at: ftp://ftp.ncbi.nih.gov/pub/COG/.
datatype.name: COGs
datatype.definition: Clusters of Orthologous Groups of proteins (COGs) were delineated by comparing protein sequences encoded in complete genomes, representing major phylogenetic lineages. Each COG consists of individual proteins or groups of paralogs from at least 3 lineages and thus corresponds to an ancient conserved domain.

datatype.name: DragonDB DNA
datatype.definition: DragonDB is a genetic and genomic database for Antirrhinum majus (Snapdragon). This collection refers to DNA sequence information.

resource.dataInfo: DragonDB DNA at University of British Columbia

datatype.name: DragonDB Protein
datatype.definition: DragonDB is a genetic and genomic database for Antirrhinum majus (Snapdragon). This collection refers to protein sequence information.

resource.dataInfo: DragonDB Protein at University of British Columbia

datatype.name: DragonDB Locus
datatype.definition: DragonDB is a genetic and genomic database for Antirrhinum majus (Snapdragon). This collection refers to Locus information.

resource.dataInfo: DragonDB Locus at University of British Columbia

datatype.name: DragonDB Allele
datatype.definition: DragonDB is a genetic and genomic database for Antirrhinum majus (Snapdragon). This collection refers to allele information.

resource.dataInfo: DragonDB Allele at University of British Columbia

restriction.statement: Images are subject to copyright.

datatype.name: ISSN
datatype.definition: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) is a unique eight-digit number used to identify a print or electronic periodical publication, rather than individual articles or books.

resource.dataInstitution: Library of Congress Online Catalogue, Washington DC

restriction.statement: Session time out prevents direct links.

datatype.name: MEROPS Family
datatype.definition: The MEROPS database is an information resource for peptidases (also termed proteases, proteinases and proteolytic enzymes) and the proteins that inhibit them. These are hierarchically classified and assigned to a Family on the basis of statistically significant similarities in amino acid sequence. Families thought to be homologous are grouped together in a Clan. This collection references peptidase families.

datatype.name: MGED Ontology
datatype.definition: The MGED Ontology (MO) provides terms for annotating all aspects of a microarray experiment from the design of the experiment and array layout, through to the preparation of the biological sample and the protocols used to hybridize the RNA and analyze the data.

resource.dataInstitution: National Center for Biomedical Ontology, Stanford University
(Ontology Working Group), European Bioinformatics Institute, Hinxton, Cambridge

datatype.name: NASC code
datatype.definition: The Nottingham Arabidopsis Stock Centre (NASC) provides seed and information resources to the International Arabidopsis Genome Programme and the wider research community.

resource.dataInstitution: The Nottingham Arabidopsis Stock Centre, University of Nottingham

datatype.name: NIAEST
datatype.definition: A catalog of mouse genes expressed in early embryos, embryonic and adult stem cells, including 250000 ESTs, was assembled by the NIA (National Institute on Aging) assembled.This collection represents the name and sequence from individual cDNA clones.

resource.dataInfo: NIAEST at National Institute on Aging

datatype.name: Pazar Transcription Factor
datatype.definition: The PAZAR database unites independently created and maintained data collections of transcription factor and regulatory sequence annotation. It provides information on the sequence and target of individual transcription factors.

resource.dataInfo: Pazar Transcription Factor at University of British Columbia
resource.dataInstitution: Centre for Molecular Medicine and Therapeutics, University of British Columbia, Vancouver

datatype.name: Plant Ontology
datatype.definition: The Plant Ontology is a structured vocabulary and database resource that links plant anatomy, morphology and growth and development to plant genomics data.

resource.dataInstitution: Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, Cold Spring Harbor, New York
National Center for Biomedical Ontology, Stanford

datatype.name: RNA Modification Database
datatype.definition: The RNA modification database provides a comprehensive listing of post-transcriptionally modified nucleosides from RNA. The database consists of all RNA-derived ribonucleosides of known structure, including those from established sequence positions, as well as those detected or characterized from hydrolysates of RNA.

resource.dataInfo: RNA Modification Database at University of Utah
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Medicinal Chemistry and Department of Biochemistry, University of Utah, Salt Lake City, Utah

datatype.definition: The Database of Cell Signaling (Science Signaling) contains information on signaling components and their relations. The data are organized into signaling pathways called Connections Maps and are provided by leading authorities in the field. This collection refers to pathway independent component information.

resource.dataInfo: Science Signaling: Pathway-Independent Component at Science Magazine

datatype.name: Science Signaling Pathway-Dependent Component
datatype.definition: The Database of Cell Signaling (Science Signaling) contains information on signaling components and their relations. The data are organized into signaling pathways called Connections Maps and are provided by leading authorities in the field. This collection refers to pathway-dependent component information.

resource.dataInfo: Science Signaling: Pathway-dependent Component at Science Magazine

datatype.name: Science Signaling Pathway
datatype.definition: The Database of Cell Signaling (Science Signaling) contains information on signaling components and their relations. The data are organized into signaling pathways called Connections Maps and are provided by leading authorities in the field. This collection refers to pathway information.

resource.dataInfo: Science Signaling: Pathway at Science Magazine

restriction.statement: material for personal and noncommercial use

datatype.name: TreeBASE
datatype.definition: TreeBASE is a relational database designed to manage and explore information on phylogenetic relationships. It includes phylogenetic trees and data matrices, together with information about the relevant publication, taxa, morphological and sequence-based characters, and published analyses. Data in TreeBASE are exposed to the public if they are used in a publication that is in press or published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, etc.

resource.dataInfo: TreeBASE (hosted at National Evolutionary Synthesis Center)
resource.dataInstitution: Phyloinformatics Research Foundation, Durham, North Carolina

datatype.name: Tetrahymena Genome Database
datatype.definition: The Tetrahymena Genome Database (TGD) Wiki is a database of information about the Tetrahymena thermophila genome sequence. It provides information curated from the literature about each published gene, including a standardized gene name, a link to the genomic locus, gene product annotations utilizing the Gene Ontology, and links to published literature.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Genetics, School of Medicine, Stanford University, Stanford, California

datatype.comment: CMR is no longer supported by the JCVI and has been taken offline. More information at: http://www.jcvi.org/cms/research/past-projects/cmr/overview/
datatype.name: CMR Gene
datatype.definition: The Comprehensive Microbial Resource (CMR) contains annotation for all complete microbial genomes and allows for a wide variety of data retrievals. This collection refers to the Gene Page which provides information pertaining to a specific gene such as the Locus Name, Gene Symbol, Coordinates, DNA Molecule Name, and Gene Length.

resource.dataInstitution: The Institute for Genomic Research, Rockville, Maryland

datatype.name: TIGRFAMS
datatype.definition: TIGRFAMs is a resource consisting of curated multiple sequence alignments, Hidden Markov Models (HMMs) for protein sequence classification, and associated information designed to support automated annotation of (mostly prokaryotic) proteins.

resource.dataInstitution: The Institute for Genomic Research, Rockville, Maryland

datatype.name: Animal TFDB Family
datatype.definition: The Animal Transcription Factor DataBase (AnimalTFDB) classifies TFs in sequenced animal genomes, as well as collecting the transcription co-factors and chromatin remodeling factors of those genomes. This collections refers to transcription factor families, and the species in which they are found.

resource.dataInfo: Animal TFDB at Hubei Bioinformatics & Molecular Imaging Key Laboratory
resource.dataInstitution: Hubei Bioinformatics and Molecular Imaging Key Laboratory, Wuhan

datatype.definition: The IUPHAR Compendium details the molecular, biophysical and pharmacological properties of identified mammalian sodium, calcium and potassium channels, as well as the related cyclic nucleotide-modulated ion channels and the recently described transient receptor potential channels. It includes information on nomenclature systems, and on inter and intra-species molecular structure variation. This collection references families of receptors or subunits.

resource.dataInfo: IUPHAR family at University of Edinburgh
resource.dataInstitution: Centre for Cardiovascular Science, University of Edinburgh, Edinburgh

synonyms.synonym: Database for Bacterial Group II Introns

datatype.definition: The Database for Bacterial Group II Introns provides a catalogue of full-length, non-redundant group II introns present in bacterial DNA sequences in GenBank.

resource.dataInfo: Bacterial Group II Introns at University of Calgary
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Biological Sciences, University of Calgary, Calgary, Alberta

restriction.statement: Some introns from previous versions have been removed.

datatype.name: Spectral Database for Organic Compounds
datatype.definition: The Spectral Database for Organic Compounds (SDBS) is an integrated spectral database system for organic compounds. It provides access to 6 different types of spectra for each compound, including Mass spectrum (EI-MS), a Fourier transform infrared spectrum (FT-IR), and NMR spectra.

resource.dataInstitution: National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST)

datatype.definition: The database VBASE2 provides germ-line sequences of human and mouse immunoglobulin variable (V) genes.

resource.dataInfo: Vbase2 at German Research Centre for Biotechnology
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Experimental Immunology, German Research Centre for Biotechnology, Braunschweig

restriction.statement: Non-commercial use only
The date given for last database update is 2006, hence information may be outdated.

datatype.name: SPIKE Map
datatype.definition: SPIKE (Signaling Pathways Integrated Knowledge Engine) is a repository that can store, organise and allow retrieval of pathway information in a way that will be useful for the research community. The database currently focuses primarily on pathways describing DNA damage response, cell cycle, programmed cell death and hearing related pathways. Pathways are regularly updated, and additional pathways are gradually added. The complete database and the individual maps are freely exportable in several formats. This collection references pathway maps.

resource.dataInfo: SPIKE database at Tel Aviv University
resource.dataInstitution: School of Computer Sciences and School of Medicine, Tel Aviv University

datatype.name: METLIN

synonyms.synonym: Metabolite and Tandem Mass Spectrometry Database

datatype.definition: The METLIN (Metabolite and Tandem Mass Spectrometry) Database is a repository of metabolite information as well as tandem mass spectrometry data, providing public access to its comprehensive MS and MS/MS metabolite data. An annotated list of known metabolites and their mass, chemical formula, and structure are available, with each metabolite linked to external resources for further reference and inquiry.

resource.dataInfo: METLIN at Scripps Center, Molecular Biology and Center for Mass Spectrometry, La Jolla

restriction.statement: METLIN services may not be used in commercial applications.

datatype.name: GeneCards
datatype.definition: The GeneCards human gene database stores gene related transcriptomic, genetic, proteomic, functional and disease information. It uses standard nomenclature and approved gene symbols. GeneCards presents a complete summary for each human gene.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Molecular Genetics, Weizmann Institute of Science, Rehovot
University Health Network, University of Toronoto, Toronto
Univ of Texas M.D. Anderson Cancer Center, Houston, Texas
Dept. of Clinical and Biological Sciences , Univ of Torino
Laboratory of Bioinformatics, Wageningen UR, Wageningen
Human Genome Center, Institute of Medical Science, Univ of Tokyo

The goal of the UM-BBD is to provide information on microbial enzyme-catalyzed reactions that are important for biotechnology. This collection refers to reaction information.

The goal of the UM-BBD is to provide information on microbial enzyme-catalyzed reactions that are important for biotechnology. This collection refers to enzyme information.

Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database (Enzyme) at University of Minnesota

datatype.name: UM-BBD Pathway
datatype.definition: The University of Minnesota Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database (UM-BBD) contains information on microbial biocatalytic reactions and biodegradation pathways for primarily xenobiotic, chemical compounds. The goal of the UM-BBD is to provide information on microbial enzyme-catalyzed reactions that are important for biotechnology. This collection refers to pathway information.

resource.dataInfo: Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database Mirror (Pathway) at ETH Zurich
Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database (Pathway) at University of Minnesota
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Laboratory Medicine and Pathology, University of Minnesota, Minnesota

datatype.name: UM-BBD Biotransformation Rule
datatype.definition: The University of Minnesota Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database (UM-BBD) contains information on microbial biocatalytic reactions and biodegradation pathways for primarily xenobiotic, chemical compounds. The UM-BBD Pathway Prediction System (PPS) predicts microbial catabolic reactions using substructure searching, a rule-base, and atom-to-atom mapping. The PPS recognizes organic functional groups found in a compound and predicts transformations based on biotransformation rules. These rules are based on reactions found in the UM-BBD database. This collection references those rules.

resource.dataInfo: Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database Mirror (Biotransformation Rule) at ETH Zurich
Biocatalysis/Biodegradation Database Mirror (Biotransformation Rules) at University of Minnesota
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Laboratory Medicine and Pathology, University of Minnesota, Minnesota

datatype.name: mirEX
datatype.definition: mirEX is a comprehensive platform for comparative analysis of primary microRNA expression data, storing RTqPCR-based gene expression profile over seven development stages of Arabidopsis. It also provides RNA structural models, publicly available deep sequencing results and experimental procedure details. This collection provides profile information for a single microRNA over all development stages.

resource.dataInstitution: Institute of Molecular Biology, Adam Mickiewicz University, Poznan

datatype.name: Dictybase EST
datatype.definition: The dictyBase database provides data on the model organism Dictyostelium discoideum and related species. It contains the complete genome sequence, ESTs, gene models and functional annotations. This collection references expressed sequence tag (EST) information.

resource.dataInstitution: Northwestern University Biomedical Informatics Center and Center for Genetic Medicine, Chicago, Illinois

datatype.name: IMGT HLA
datatype.definition: IMGT, the international ImMunoGeneTics project, is a collection of high-quality integrated databases specialising in Immunoglobulins, T cell receptors and the Major Histocompatibility Complex (MHC) of all vertebrate species. IMGT/HLA is a database for sequences of the human MHC, referred to as HLA. It includes all the official sequences for the WHO Nomenclature Committee For Factors of the HLA System. This collection references allele information through the WHO nomenclature.

datatype.name: Flystock

synonyms.synonym: Bloomington Drosophila Stock Center at Indiana University

datatype.definition: The Bloomington Drosophila Stock Center collects, maintains and distributes Drosophila melanogaster strains for research.

resource.dataInstitution: BDSC, Department of Biology, Indiana University, Bloomington

datatype.name: OPM
datatype.definition: The Orientations of Proteins in Membranes (OPM) database provides spatial positions of membrane-bound peptides and proteins of known three-dimensional structure in the lipid bilayer, together with their structural classification, topology and intracellular localization.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Medicinal Chemistry, College of Pharmacy, University of Michigan

restriction.statement: Based upon, and uses identifiers from, a subset of PDB entries.

datatype.name: Allergome
datatype.definition: Allergome is a repository of data related to all IgE-binding compounds. Its purpose is to collect a list of allergenic sources and molecules by using the widest selection criteria and sources.

resource.dataInstitution: Center for Clinical and Experimental Allergology, Rome

restriction.statement: Non-commercial license associated.

datatype.name: PomBase
datatype.definition: PomBase is a model organism database established to provide access to molecular data and biological information for the fission yeast Schizosaccharomyces pombe. It encompasses annotation of genomic sequence and features, comprehensive manual literature curation and genome-wide data sets.

resource.dataInstitution: Cambridge Systems Biology Centre, Department of Biochemistry, University of Cambridge

datatype.name: HPA
datatype.definition: The Human Protein Atlas (HPA) is a publicly available database with high-resolution images showing the spatial distribution of proteins in different normal and cancer human cell lines. Primary access to this collection is through Ensembl Gene identifiers.

resource.dataInfo: Human Protein Atlas at AlbaNova University
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Proteomics, School of Biotechnology, AlbaNova University Center, Stockholm

restriction.statement: May not be suitable for commercial use.

datatype.name: JAX Mice
datatype.definition: JAX Mice is a catalogue of mouse strains supplied by the Jackson Laboratory.

restriction.statement: free for non-commercial or personal use

datatype.name: uBio NameBank
datatype.definition: NameBank is a "biological name server" focused on storing names and objectively-derived nomenclatural attributes. NameBank is a repository for all recorded names including scientific names, vernacular (or common names), misspelled names, as well as ad-hoc nomenclatural labels that may have limited context.

resource.dataInfo: uBio NameBank at The Marine Biological Laboratory
resource.dataInstitution: Marine Biological Laboratory, Woods Hole, Massachusetts

datatype.name: YeTFasCo
datatype.definition: The Yeast Transcription Factor Specificity Compendium (YeTFasCO) is a database of transcription factor specificities for the yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae in Position Frequency Matrix (PFM) or Position Weight Matrix (PWM) formats.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Molecular Genetics, Terrence Donnelly Centre for Cellular and Biomolecular Research, University of Toronto, Toronto

datatype.name: TarBase
datatype.definition: TarBase stores microRNA (miRNA) information for miRNAgene interactions, as well as miRNA- and gene-related facts to information specific to the interaction and the experimental validation methodologies used.

datatype.name: CharProt
datatype.definition: CharProt is a database of biochemically characterized proteins designed to support automated annotation pipelines. Entries are annotated with gene name, symbol and various controlled vocabulary terms, including Gene Ontology terms, Enzyme Commission number and TransportDB accession.

resource.dataInstitution: J Craig Venter institute, Rockville, Maryland

datatype.name: OMA Protein
datatype.definition: OMA (Orthologous MAtrix) is a database that identifies orthologs among publicly available, complete genome sequences. It identifies orthologous relationships which can be accessed either group-wise, where all group members are orthologous to all other group members, or on a sequence-centric basis, where for a given protein all its orthologs in all other species are displayed. This collection references individual protein records.

resource.dataInfo: OMA Protein through OMA browser at ETH Zurich

restriction.statement: Terms of service under a noncommercial license.

datatype.name: OMA Group
datatype.definition: OMA (Orthologous MAtrix) is a database that identifies orthologs among publicly available, complete genome sequences. It identifies orthologous relationships which can be accessed either group-wise, where all group members are orthologous to all other group members, or on a sequence-centric basis, where for a given protein all its orthologs in all other species are displayed. This collection references groupings of orthologs.

resource.dataInfo: OMA Group through OMA browser at ETH Zurich

restriction.statement: Terms of service under a noncommercial license.

datatype.name: NCBI Protein
datatype.definition: The Protein database is a collection of sequences from several sources, including translations from annotated coding regions in GenBank, RefSeq and TPA, as well as records from SwissProt, PIR, PRF, and PDB.

restriction.statement: This collection is an aggregation of a variety of data sources.

datatype.name: GenPept
datatype.definition: The GenPept database is a collection of sequences based on translations from annotated coding regions in GenBank.

restriction.statement: This collection is a subset of the information found in the NCBI protein database.

datatype.name: UniGene
datatype.definition: A UniGene entry is a set of transcript sequences that appear to come from the same transcription locus (gene or expressed pseudogene), together with information on protein similarities, gene expression, cDNA clone reagents, and genomic location.

restriction.statement: It is not possible to directly specify a cluster ID without providing an organism abbreviation.

datatype.name: BitterDB Receptor
datatype.definition: BitterDB is a database of compounds reported to taste bitter to humans. The compounds can be searched by name, chemical structure, similarity to other bitter compounds, association with a particular human bitter taste receptor, and so on. The database also contains information on mutations in bitter taste receptors that were shown to influence receptor activation by bitter compounds. The aim of BitterDB is to facilitate studying the chemical features associated with bitterness. This collection references receptors.

resource.dataInfo: BitterDB Receptor at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
resource.dataInstitution: The Robert H Smith Faculty of Agriculture, Food and Environment, The Institute of Biochemistry, Food Science and Nutrition, The Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Rehovot

datatype.name: BitterDB Compound
datatype.definition: BitterDB is a database of compounds reported to taste bitter to humans. The compounds can be searched by name, chemical structure, similarity to other bitter compounds, association with a particular human bitter taste receptor, and so on. The database also contains information on mutations in bitter taste receptors that were shown to influence receptor activation by bitter compounds. The aim of BitterDB is to facilitate studying the chemical features associated with bitterness. This collection references compounds.

resource.dataInfo: BitterDB Compound at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
resource.dataInstitution: The Robert H Smith Faculty of Agriculture, Food and Environment, The Institute of Biochemistry, Food Science and Nutrition, The Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Rehovot

datatype.name: BioProject
datatype.definition: BioProject provides an organizational framework to access metadata about research projects and the data from the projects that are deposited into different databases. It provides information about a projects scope, material, objectives, funding source and general relevance categories.

resource.dataInfo: BioProject at DNA Data Bank of Japan
resource.dataInstitution: DNA Data Bank of Japan, Shizuoka

datatype.name: BioSample
datatype.definition: The BioSample Database stores information about biological samples used in molecular experiments, such as sequencing, gene expression or proteomics. It includes reference samples, such as cell lines, which are repeatedly used in experiments. Accession numbers for the reference samples will be exchanged with a similar database at NCBI, and DDBJ (Japan). Record access may be affected due to different release cycles and inter-institutional synchronisation.

resource.dataInfo: BioSample at DNA Data Bank of Japan
resource.dataInstitution: Institution DNA Data Bank of Japan, Shizuoka

datatype.name: PiroplasmaDB
datatype.definition: PiroplasmaDB is one of the databases that can be accessed through the EuPathDB (http://EuPathDB.org; formerly ApiDB) portal, covering eukaryotic pathogens of the genera Cryptosporidium, Giardia, Leishmania, Neospora, Plasmodium, Toxoplasma, Trichomonas and Trypanosoma. While each of these groups is supported by a taxon-specific database built upon the same infrastructure, the EuPathDB portal offers an entry point to all these resources, and the opportunity to leverage orthology for searches across genera.

resource.dataInstitution: Center for Tropical & Emerging Global Diseases, University of Georgia, Georgia

datatype.name: Unite
datatype.definition: UNITE is a fungal rDNA internal transcribed spacer (ITS) sequence database. It focuses on high-quality ITS sequences generated from fruiting bodies collected and identified by experts and deposited in public herbaria. Entries may be supplemented with metadata on describing locality, habitat, soil, climate, and interacting taxa.

resource.dataInstitution: Institute of Botany, University of Tartu, Tartu

datatype.name: NCIm
datatype.definition: NCI Metathesaurus (NCIm) is a wide-ranging biomedical terminology database that covers most terminologies used by NCI for clinical care, translational and basic research, and public information and administrative activities. It integrates terms and definitions from different terminologies, including NCI Thesaurus, however the representation is not identical.

resource.dataInstitution: National Cancer Institute, Center for Bioinformatics, Maryland

restriction.statement: Some proprietary terminologies are included, with permission, and have restrictions on their use.

datatype.name: ProGlycProt
datatype.definition: ProGlycProt (Prokaryotic Glycoprotein) is a repository of bacterial and archaeal glycoproteins with at least one experimentally validated glycosite (glycosylated residue). Each entry in the database is fully cross-referenced and enriched with available published information about source organism, coding gene, protein, glycosites, glycosylation type, attached glycan, associated oligosaccharyl/glycosyl transferases (OSTs/GTs), supporting references, and applicable additional information.

resource.dataInstitution: Institute of Microbial Technology, Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), Chandigarh

datatype.name: PolBase
datatype.definition: Polbase is a database of DNA polymerases providing information on polymerase protein sequence, target DNA sequence, enzyme structure, sequence mutations and details on polymerase activity.

datatype.name: NucleaRDB
datatype.definition: NucleaRDB is an information system that stores heterogenous data on Nuclear Hormone Receptors (NHRs). It contains data on sequences, ligand binding constants and mutations for NHRs.

resource.dataInfo: NucleaRDB at Radboud University Nijmegen Medical Centre
resource.dataInstitution: CMBI, Radboud University Nijmegen Medical Centre, Dreijenplein, Wageningen

datatype.name: SUPFAM
datatype.definition: SUPERFAMILY provides structural, functional and evolutionary information for proteins from all completely sequenced genomes, and large sequence collections such as UniProt.

resource.dataInfo: SUPFAM at MRC and University of Bristol
resource.dataInstitution: MRC Laboratory of Molecular Biology, Cambridge

datatype.name: Rice Genome Annotation Project
datatype.definition: The objective of this project is to provide high quality annotation for the rice genome Oryza sativa spp japonica cv Nipponbare. All genes are annotated with functional annotation including expression data, gene ontologies, and tagged lines.

resource.dataInfo: Rice Genome Annotation Project at TIGR
resource.dataInstitution: The Institute for Genomic Research, Rockville, Maryland

datatype.name: PINA
datatype.definition: Protein Interaction Network Analysis (PINA) platform is an integrated platform for protein interaction network construction, filtering, analysis, visualization and management. It integrates protein-protein interaction data from six public curated databases and builds a complete, non-redundant protein interaction dataset for six model organisms.

resource.dataInfo: Protein Interaction Network Analysis (PINA) at Garvan Institute
resource.dataInstitution: Garvan Institute of Medical Research, Sydney

restriction.statement: Protein-protein interaction data from IntAct, MINT, BioGRID, DIP, HPRD, MIPS/MPact, and Protein annotations from UniProt, Ensembl, WormBase.

datatype.name: Tissue List
datatype.definition: The UniProt Tissue List is a controlled vocabulary of terms used to annotate biological tissues. It also contains cross-references to other ontologies where tissue types are specified.

resource.dataInfo: Tissue List at Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics

datatype.name: BacMap Biography
datatype.definition: BacMap is an electronic, interactive atlas of fully sequenced bacterial genomes. It contains labeled, zoomable and searchable chromosome maps for sequenced prokaryotic (archaebacterial and eubacterial) species. Each map can be zoomed to the level of individual genes and each gene is hyperlinked to a richly annotated gene card. All bacterial genome maps are supplemented with separate prophage genome maps as well as separate tRNA and rRNA maps. Each bacterial chromosome entry in BacMap contains graphs and tables on a variety of gene and protein statistics. Likewise, every bacterial species entry contains a bacterial 'biography' card, with taxonomic details, phenotypic details, textual descriptions and images. This collection references 'biography' information.

resource.dataInfo: BacMap Biography at University of Alberta
resource.dataInstitution: Department of Computing Science, Food and Nutritional Science, University of Alberta, Edmonton

datatype.name: HGNC Symbol
datatype.definition: The HGNC (HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee) provides an approved gene name and symbol (short-form abbreviation) for each known human gene. All approved symbols are stored in the HGNC database, and each symbol is unique. This collection refers to records using the HGNC symbol.

resource.dataInfo: HGNC Symbol at HUGO Genome Nomenclature Committee

restriction.statement: The main HGNC collection [MIR:00000080] should be used in preference as it has more robust identifiers.

datatype.name: PANTHER Pathway
datatype.definition: The PANTHER (Protein ANalysis THrough Evolutionary Relationships) Classification System is a resource that classifies genes by their functions, using published scientific experimental evidence and evolutionary relationships to predict function even in the absence of direct experimental evidence. The PANTHER Pathway collection references pathway information, primarily for signaling pathways, each with subfamilies and protein sequences mapped to individual pathway components.

resource.dataInstitution: Keck School of Medicine, University of Southern California

datatype.name: FAIRsharing
datatype.definition: The web-based FAIRSharing catalogues aim to centralize bioscience data policies, reporting standards and links to other related portals. This collection references bioinformatics data exchange standards, which includes 'Reporting Guidelines', Format Specifications and Terminologies.

resource.dataInstitution: Oxford e-Research Centre, University of Oxford, Oxford

datatype.name: FungiDB
datatype.definition: FungiDB is a genomic resource for fungal genomes. It contains contains genome sequence and annotation from several fungal classes, including the Ascomycota classes, Eurotiomycetes, Sordariomycetes, Saccharomycetes and the Basidiomycota orders, Pucciniomycetes and Tremellomycetes, and the basal 'Zygomycete' lineage Mucormycotina.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Plant Pathology & Microbiology, University of California, Riverside, California

restriction.statement: Provides access to information from multiple fungal species.

datatype.name: DARC
datatype.definition: DARC (Database of Aligned Ribosomal Complexes) stores available cryo-EM (electron microscopy) data and atomic coordinates of ribosomal particles from the PDB, which are aligned within a common coordinate system. The aligned coordinate system simplifies direct visualization of conformational changes in the ribosome, such as subunit rotation and head-swiveling, as well as direct comparison of bound ligands, such as antibiotics or translation factors.

resource.dataInstitution: Gene Center and Department for Biochemistry and Center for integrated Protein Science Munich, University of Munich, Munich

datatype.name: DRSC
datatype.definition: The DRSC (Drosophila RNAi Screening Cente) tracks both production of reagents for RNA interference (RNAi) screening in Drosophila cells and RNAi screen results. It maintains a list of Drosophila gene names, identifiers, symbols and synonyms and provides information for cell-based or in vivo RNAi reagents, other types of reagents, screen results, etc. corresponding for a given gene.

resource.dataInstitution: Department of Genetics, Harvard Medical School, Boston, Massachusetts

datatype.name: OriDB Schizosaccharomyces
datatype.definition: OriDB is a database of collated genome-wide mapping studies of confirmed and predicted replication origin sites in Saccharomyces cerevisiae and the fission yeast Schizosaccharomyces pombe. This collection references Schizosaccharomyces pombe.

resource.dataInfo: OriDB Schizosaccharomyces at University of Nottingham
resource.dataInstitution: Centre for Genetics and Genomics, The University of Nottingham, Queen's Medical Centre, Nottingham

datatype.name: OriDB Saccharomyces
datatype.definition: OriDB is a database of collated genome-wide mapping studies of confirmed and predicted replication origin sites in Saccharomyces cerevisiae and the fission yeast Schizosaccharomyces pombe. This collection references Saccharomyces cerevisiae.

resource.dataInfo: OriDB Saccharomyces at University of Nottingham
resource.dataInstitution: Centre for Genetics and Genomics, The University of Nottingham, Queen's Medical Centre, Nottingham

datatype.name: PSCDB
datatype.definition: The PSCDB (Protein Structural Change DataBase) collects information on the relationship between protein structural change upon ligand binding. Each entry page provides detailed information about this structural motion.

resource.dataInstitution: Graduate School of Information Science, Nagoya University, Furo-cho, Chikusa-ku

datatype.name: SCOP
datatype.definition: The SCOP (Structural Classification of Protein) database is a comprehensive ordering of all proteins of known structure according to their evolutionary, functional and structural relationships.
